tool.name: NetCDFToExcelTool

param.name: in_netCDF_file
param.dialogReference: Input the netCDF file that contains multidimensional inputs that you want to process into an Excel workbook.

param.name: dimensions
param.dialogReference: Select the multiple dimensions from the netCDF file for processing. The order matters in dimension selecting.

param.name: variable
param.dialogReference: Select the variable in which there is unique information from each layer in the first dimensions. The first value will be used as the naming convention for the Excel sheets within the Excel workbook.

param.name: slices
param.dialogReference: Set a bounds for the selected dimensions. This begins indexing at zero. Example: If the dimension is named 'N_STATIONS' and I only want the first 'N_STATIONS'. The correct input would be N_STATIONS, 0, 1

param.name: excel_file_name
param.dialogReference: Input the desired name for the Excel Workbook that will be created with successful running of the tool.

param.name: out_folder
param.dialogReference: Choose the output destination for the Excel Workbook to be created.

tool.summary: The NetCDF to Excel will be used on multidimensional NetCDF files to transform into an Excel workbook containing data from the second dimension selected. Once done with that, will be able to use the Excel to Points tool on the newly created Excel workbook to turn them all into point feature classes.
tool.usage: For multidimensional netCDF files to be processed into Excel Workbook.
